alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 2:16PM PST until February 21 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 to 4 inches valleys and 5 to 10 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Eastport, Springdale-Hunters Road, Northport, Metaline Falls, Colville, Bonners Ferry, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Fruitland, Sandpoint, Deer Park, Chewelah, Tiger, Flowery Trail Road, Orin-Rice Road, Athol, Ione, Priest River, Newport, Metaline, Clark Fork, and Kettle Falls. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 10 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Untreated roads will likely become very slick by early Tuesday evening as temperatures quickly drop. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tuesday morning accumulations are possible mainly around Metaline Falls and the North Idaho Panhandle. The majority of the accumulations are expected Tuesday afternoon into the evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
